hedline.hl1: World News Briefs;Polls Closed by Strife Are Opened in India

block.p: India opened more than 400 polling places today to allow voting in areas where violence had marred the first day of the country's general elections on Saturday.

Saturday was the first day of a phased voting process across the country. The second phase will be on Thursday, when about 223 million of India's 590 million voters will be entitled to cast their ballots.
India opened more than 400 polling places today to allow voting in areas where violence had marred the first day of the country's general elections on Saturday.

Saturday was the first day of a phased voting process across the country. The second phase will be on Thursday, when about 223 million of India's 590 million voters will be entitled to cast their ballots.

Most of the balloting today was in the troubled northeastern state of Assam and in Andhra Pradesh, the home base of Prime Minister P. V. Narasimha Rao, whose Congress Party is facing a major challenge in the elections.
The Election Commission said that the voting today was largely peaceful. Indian news agencies said five people were killed in election-related violence in Andhra Pradesh Monday night and today.
